result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donavan V Robarge

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Donavan V Robarge in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith in court for Donavan V Robarge. Court Reporter appears by zoom video.

9:01  Court relates and gives appearances.
9:02  State gives recommendation.
9:04  Atty. Smith relates.
9:04  Court questions defendant.
9:11  Atty. Smith relates.
9:12  Defendant makes statement.

Count #1:  .266 BAC - Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same.  Defendant agrees there were two prior convictions.  Atty. Smith agrees there are no collateral attacks to prior convictions.
$3,264.00 fine; 60 days to  pay.
AODA
30 month revocation of drivers license.
30 month IID
80 days jail with huber and good time; report by 10:00 AM this morning with credit for 3 days served.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 

Count #2:  State moves to amend to unlawful use of telephone - harassment - 947.012(1)(a) a class B misdemeanor.  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same. 
Pay costs; 60 days to pay.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 

Count #3:  Court dismisses.

22TR302:  Court dismisses.
Plea hearing on November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 12, 2022 at 08:00 am.

10:11 AM Defendant Donavan Vernon Robarge in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith in court for Donavan Vernon Robarge.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
COVERS 22CF66 & 22TR302.

Formal reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered to both files. Scheduling conference set for today at 2:00 p.m.. by conference bridge and 22TR302 to track.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:08 AM Defendant Donavan V Robarge in court.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith appeared by video for Donavan V Robarge. 
COVERS 22CF66 & 22TR302.
Attorney smith relates on Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and binds over for trial.  Arraignment set and must appear in person.  Reminder note given to Defendant in court.
Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Citation to track.
Letter from Attorney Smith regarding preliminary hearing and zoom.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donavan V Robarge appeared by video.  Attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith appeared by video for Donavan V Robarge. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 22CF66 AND 22TR302

22CF66:  NG plea entered to count #1.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives further reading of same; waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status Plea and/or prelim hearing set before Judge Babler.
Bond to continue.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
22TR302: Track with 22CF66
Attorney Elizabeth Smith appears on behalf of Donavan Robarge

Adjustment Number: 22A 017252,
Payable Number: 125845,
Receipt Number: 22RP000743,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Donavan V Robarge appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow (for today) for Donavan V Robarge appeared by video. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint.
AIA set BEFORE JUDGE BOYLE; must appear in person.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
